txt.en: 'This seems a good enough place to rest for a bit.'
You can imagine Fram, uncertain in his decision to bring his people north
DNT
'What a view! It seems the mountain fog is too thick to see Erebor today.'
History, etched in the stones of time, can be looked at from many views and read with just as many interpretations.
Léothred can be found at Limlók in the Floodfells.\n\nYou should travel to Limlók.
The Carrock can be found in the Beorninglands.\n\nYou should climb to the top of the Carrock and meet Léothred there.
Climb atop the Carrock
Talk to Léothred atop the Carrock

'For a time the folklore of the Ai-thúda held that it was Fram, not the Dwarf-king Durin, who first beheld the Lonely Mountain, though no tale among Durin’s Folk mentions him. There may be some truth in this claim. I still wonder, which story is true? I fear the story of Fram may have been embellished in places over the years.'
'You are heading to Limlók, yes? I will accompany you.'
'Folklore of the Ai-thúda held that it was Fram, not the Dwarf-king Durin, who first beheld the Lonely Mountain.'

'You are heading to Limlók, yes? I will accompany you. It would seem the story I seek follows the same path. Might we stop at the Carrock on our way? I would very much like to see for myself. There is some Rohirric history there as well, if you can believe it.'
'This seems a good enough place to rest for a bit.'
Complete \qTo the Floodfells\q
<rgb=#FF0000>Look</rgb> out from atop the Carrock
The Carrock can be found in the Beorninglands.\n\nYou should look out from the top of the Carrock.
Léothred can be found at Limlók in the Floodfells.\n\nYou should travel to Limlók.
Léothred can be found at the Carrock.\n\nYou should talk to Léothred.
History Etched in Stone
Talk to Léothred at Limlók
